    • read

      public org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceResponse read(org.forgerock.json.resource.ReadRequest request) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException

      The object will contain metadata properties, including object identifier _id, and object version _rev to enable optimistic concurrency supported by OrientDB and OpenIDM.

      Specified by:
      read in interface RepoBootService
      Specified by:
      read in interface RepositoryService
      Parameters:
      request - the identifier of the object to retrieve from the object set.
      Returns:
      the requested object.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - if an error was encountered during the read.

    • create

      public org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceResponse create(org.forgerock.json.resource.CreateRequest request) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Creates a new object in the object set.

      This method sets the _id property to the assigned identifier for the object, and the _rev property to the revised object version (For optimistic concurrency)

      Specified by:
      create in interface RepoBootService
      Specified by:
      create in interface RepositoryService
      Parameters:
      request - the contents of the object to create in the object set.
      Returns:
      the created resource
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified id could not be resolved.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or object set is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if an object with the same ID already exists.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - if an error was encountered during creation

    • update

      public org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceResponse update(org.forgerock.json.resource.UpdateRequest request) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Updates the specified object in the object set.

      This implementation does not require MVCC and uses the current revision if no revision is specified in the request.

      If successful, this method updates metadata properties within the passed object, including: a new _rev value for the revised object's version

      Specified by:
      update in interface RepoBootService
      Specified by:
      update in interface RepositoryService
      Parameters:
      request - the contents of the object to update
      Returns:
      the updated resource
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if version is required but is null.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if version did not match the existing object in the set.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the passed identifier is invalid
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - if an error was encountered while updating

    • delete

      public org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceResponse delete(org.forgerock.json.resource.DeleteRequest request) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Deletes the specified object from the object set. Deletes a new resource in the repository.
      Specified by:
      delete in interface RepoBootService
      Specified by:
      delete in interface RepositoryService
      Parameters:
      request - the delete request
      Returns:
      an empty resource
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object is forbidden.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ConflictException - if version is required but is null.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.PreconditionFailedException - if version did not match the existing object in the set.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - if an error was encountered during the delete

    • command

      public Object command(org.forgerock.json.resource.ActionRequest request) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Execute a database command according to the details in the action request.
      Parameters:
      request - the ActionRequest
      Returns:
      the number of affected rows/records.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - on failure to resolved query

    • handleQuery

      public org.forgerock.util.promise.Promise<org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryResponse,org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException> handleQuery(org.forgerock.services.context.Context context, org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryRequest request, org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryResourceHandler handler)
      Performs the query on the specified object and returns the associated results.

      Queries are parametric; a set of named parameters is provided as the query criteria. The query result is a JSON object structure composed of basic Java types. The returned map is structured as follow: - The top level map contains meta-data about the query, plus an entry with the actual result records. - The QueryConstants defines the map keys, including the result records (QUERY_RESULT)

      Specified by:
      handleQuery in interface org.forgerock.json.resource.RequestHandler
      Parameters:
      context - identifies the object to query.
      request - the parameters of the query to perform.
      Returns:
      the query results, which includes meta-data and the result records in JSON object structure format.
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.NotFoundException - if the specified object could not be found.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.BadRequestException - if the specified params contain invalid arguments, e.g. a query id that is not configured, a query expression that is invalid, or missing query substitution tokens.
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ForbiddenException - if access to the object or specified query is forbidden.

    • query

      public List<org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceResponse> query(org.forgerock.json.resource.QueryRequest request) throws org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException
      Description copied from interface: RepositoryService
      Queries resources in the repository. Must provide built in query support for queryid query-all-ids.
      Specified by:
      query in interface RepoBootService
      Specified by:
      query in interface RepositoryService
      Parameters:
      request - the query request
      Returns:
      a list containing the query results
      Throws:
      org.forgerock.json.resource.ResourceException - if an error was encountered during query
